pathTokens: Wrangell, St. Elias, University and Fairweather Ranges

content.description:
Mount Abbe is an island of granite in the midst of a giant mountain range of really bad rock.  Most of the Chugach-Saint Elias-Fairweather ranges are composed of trench scrapings like the infamous Chugach Crud of Turnagain Arm ("climbing" near Anchorage).  A terrible accident following the first ascent may be the reason this excellent peak remains relatively unknown. 

Glacier Bay from Landsat, 1999
